title: Kokkattan Recipe, Rice & Palm Jaggery finger food for Babies
content:
Kokkattan Recipe – Rice & Palm Jaggery Finger Food For Babies with step wise pictures.

Best finger food for babies, this rice and palm jaggery fingers are so easy to make and are very nutritious for your babies. This is rich in carb and iron.

I was waiting for a long time to share this recipe. This is traditional finger food for babies. It is nutritious and easy to make for your kids. Since it is shaped in a long shape, it is easy for your baby or toddler to hold in their tiny hands. The sweetness is from palm jaggery which is very good for babies.

This snack is high in carb and iron.

 

Kokkattan Recipe - Rice & Palm Jaggery Finger Food For Babies

 

Preparation time

10 mins

 

Cook time

30 mins

 

Total time

40 mins

 

Recipe type: Baby Food

Cuisine: Indian

Serves: 12 to 15 pieces

 

Ingredients

Rice - 1 cup

Palm Jaggery - 1 cup

Water - ½ cup

Cardamom Powder - ½ tsp

Dry Ginger Powder - ½ tsp

 

Instructions

Take rice and wash it well. Drain completely.

Take it in a dry pan and roast on low heat till golden and puffed. Take it in a blender, add cardamom and ginger powder and powder fine. Set aside on a large plate.

Take palm jaggery, water in a saucepan and boil till jaggery melts. Strain to a pan.

Now cook this till the syrup thickens it till take around 6 to 10 mins. Drop a spoonful of syrup in a bowl of cold water. the syrup will stay as it is without melting and you will be able to form a hardball.

Now Take the syrup off the heat, add the syrup little by little in a small amount of the rice flour. Mix well and shape it into a long shape.

Set aside. It will harden as it cools.

Once cooled store in an airtight container.

Notes

1)Don't add syrup all at once. Just add little syrup to a small portion of the rice flour and mix. Then shape it. 

2)If you add all at once it will harden and you won't be able to take shape.

recommendations.content:
The key to making a tasty and kids friendly curd rice or yogurt rice is to add less yogurt and more milk which makes it tastier.
So give this a try and let me know how it turns out for you.

recommendations.title: Beetroot milk Recipe, Rose milk using Beetroots
recommendations.content:
